meanings.definition: A mark against someone for misconduct or a fault.
meanings.sent1: Receiving a demerit in school for talking in class is not good.
meanings.sent2: Having a demerit on your record can affect your chances of getting a promotion.
meanings.sent3: Getting a demerit for forgetting your homework can be a wake-up call.
meanings.sent4: Each demerit serves as a reminder to improve and learn from mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The demerit on his report card stood out among the gold stars.

meanings.sent1: One demerit of living in a big city is the noise pollution.
meanings.sent2: The lack of parking space is a demerit of this apartment complex.
meanings.sent3: The demerit of having a sweet tooth is the risk of cavities.
meanings.sent4: The demerit of procrastination is the added stress it brings.
meanings.sent5: She carefully weighed the merits and demerits of each option before deciding.

meanings.definition: To mark down for a fault or offense.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to demerit the student for cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: If you demerit every mistake, it may discourage others from trying.
meanings.sent3: He didn't want to demerit his friend for being late, but rules are rules.
meanings.sent4: The referee had to demerit the player for unsportsmanlike conduct.
meanings.sent5: It's important to demerit actions that go against the team's values.
